title: Tobermory Lighthouse Walk - Isle of Mull Route

images.title: Martin Cígler, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Big Tub Lighthouse, Tobermory. The structure was built in 1857 and is operated by the Northern Lighthouse Board. The lighthouse was automated in 1960 and the nearby former keepers' cottages are privately owned.

images.title: DeFacto, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tobermory waterfront. The village was founded as a fishing port in 1788 with its layout based on the designs of Dumfriesshire engineer Thomas Telford. It has a current population of about 1,000.

images.title: Pier, Tobermory by William Starkey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pier, Tobermory

images.title: Gillfoto, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tobermory. Many of the buildings on Main Street, predominantly shops and restaurants, are painted in various bright colours, making it a popular location for television programmes, such as the children's show Balamory

images.title: The Sound of Mull coastline by M J Richardson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Sound of Mull coastline

images.title: Port na Coite, Tobermory by Gordon Hatton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Port na Coite, Tobermory

images.title: Uninhabited shoreline somewhat north of Tobermory harbour by C Michael Hogan, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Uninhabited shoreline somewhat north of Tobermory harbour

images.title: Alan Stewart / Flat-out twitching
images.caption: Flat-out twitching. Looking SE from the cottage at the Rubha nan Gall lighthouse, man on ground approaching commando style (!) to get a photo of the Oyster catchers on the extreme left of the picture.

description: This walk visits the Tobermory Lighthouse on the Isle of Mull. Tobermory is a lovely place and considered one of the prettiest villages in Scotland. The historic settlement dates back to the 18th century and is noted for its picturesque harbour and brightly painted buildings along the main street. The walk starts in the village and follows a footpath north along the coast for just under 1.5 miles. Good footwear is required as the path can be quite muddy. The Rubha nan Gall lighthouse dates back to the mid 19th century and overlooks the Sound of Mull. There's fine views across the water as you make your way along the path. See the video below to see the fine views over the water you will enjoy from the elevated path. To continue your walking in the area head south to pick up the pleasant waterside trails along Loch Frisa . Here you can look out for wildlife including ponies, hen harriers and white tailed eagles.
